Issues.Title: How to keep vue page status in a vue page which have a  iframe inside in it  between tab switch
Issues.Body: ### What problem does this feature solve? I have two pages (tabA and tabB) using vue and vue-router,iview,user can switch tabs between tabA and tabB,tabA is a normal vue page,tabB is a vue page which includes iframe inside in tabB,when I switch to tabA and then click to back to tabB,however,tabB's iframe inside was refreshed,How can i keep tabB's iframe status and don't refresh between tab switchs,I tried ,however,It is useless, So what should I do to keep tabB's iframe status between tab switchs? ### What does the proposed API look like? My pages like this: ```html tabA ``` tabB ```html ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to keep vue page status in a vue page which have a  iframe inside in it  between tab switch" (#12399)

Issues.Title: Switch to `CIRCLE_PULL_REQUEST` from `CI_PULL_REQUEST`
Issues.Body:
`CI_PULL_REQUEST` has been deprecated in favor of `CIRCLE_PULL_REQUEST` as documented [here](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/0603ff695d2f41286239298210113cbe2b209e28/.circleci/config.yml).

This prevents coverage reports from being uploaded to Codecov ([example](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/vuejs/vue/781/workflows/04a4cdb5-79ff-4632-acdd-5374b2e04a66/jobs/18087))

Issues.Title: Vue 3 is unfriendly to VSCode auto-import
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
For example, VSCode finds "InjectionKey" in "@vue/runtime-core" when it is actually located in "vue".
When you click on menu item showing "InjectionKey" VSCode does nothing.

![Screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70687432/146801523-ff930741-c51c-47f4-8c8a-04af734acd82.jpg)

### What does the proposed API look like?
Organize vue structure so that it does not mislead VSCode.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Vue 3 is unfriendly to VSCode auto-import" (#12396)

Issues.Title: can't open vue from https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/vue@v2.6.10
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.10

### Reproduction link
[cdn.jsdelivr.net](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/vue@v2.6.10)







### Steps to reproduce
Our project cannot be accessed because vue cannot be obtained from https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/vue@v2.6.10，Copying the link to the browser will report an error

google chrome error info：
cdn.jsdelivr.net 通常会使用加密技术来保护您的信息。Google Chrome 此次尝试连接到 cdn.jsdelivr.net 时，此网站发回了异常的错误凭据。这可能是因为有攻击者在试图冒充 cdn.jsdelivr.net，或 Wi-Fi 登录屏幕中断了此次连接。请放心，您的信息仍然是安全的，因为 Google Chrome 尚未进行任何数据交换便停止了连接。

您目前无法访问 cdn.jsdelivr.net，因为此网站使用了 HSTS。网络错误和攻击通常是暂时的，因此，此网页稍后可能会恢复正常。

### What is expected?
can visit

### What is actually happening?
Not accessible

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "can't open vue from https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/vue@v2.6.10" (#12394)

Issues.Title: .sync is throwing a null when the input value is empty
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[github.com](https://github.com/xianshenglu/blog/issues/135)







### Steps to reproduce
write a custom input
write properties
write :value.sync="propertiesBasic.profession" for example
i am using this property because i want to bind two values from client to my dashboard

### What is expected?
i want to get nothing when the input is empty 

### What is actually happening?
But i am getting null 

---
here is the code:
<CustomInput
                  v-if="!isUpdate"
                  element-id="information_basic_profession"
                  input-type="text"
                  default-label="Profession"
                  name="information_basic_profession"
                  :value.sync="propertiesBasic.profession"
                  rules="max:100"
                  place-holder="Student"
                  max-length="100"
                  :multilinguals="multilinguals"
                  :lang="lang"
                  :label="54"
                />

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue ".sync is throwing a null when the input value is empty" (#12391)

Issues.Title: Tree Shaking Not working when using Vue.Extend
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[github.com](https://github.com/TomSmith27/test-cli-esm)







### Steps to reproduce
* Create a Vue 2 project with Vite and typescript
* Add A component that uses Vue.extend (required for typescript)
* Make the Vite Config use lib mode
* Run a build
* Run npx agadoo
* Notice how it says not tree shakeable
* Notice how it says the failed to tree shake

### What is expected?
Vite should create a tree shakable library

### What is actually happening?
Vite doesnt create tree shakable library

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Tree Shaking Not working when using Vue.Extend" (#12384)

Issues.Title: Support component with multiple top elements
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve? I have a definition list (`
`) where lots of entries are link entries. Link entries have a `
` with a caption and a button, then a `
` with an `` element. Our current code repeats a lot of common markup and attributes for those link entries. I'd like to factor them out into a component, so our definition list can have just the relevant parts, e.g. ```html ``` * The intuitive solution would be to make a component with `
…
…
` on the top level. (Current Vue would complain that there should be only one root element.) * The next best approach would be to wrap it in a `
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support component with multiple top elements" (#12383)

Issues.Title: Vue3 doesn't support mobile touch events
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io/s/ecddt](https://codesandbox.io/s/ecddt)







### Steps to reproduce
In mobile div element doesn't trigger @click event, and if you add touchstart event to the div, it is working with warrning 
 Added non-passive event listener to a scroll-blocking <some> event. Consider marking event handler as 'passive' to make the page more responsive, open the reproduction link on mobile phone, this example even wasn't created by me

### What is expected?
Expected to fire event

### What is actually happening?
nothing

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: There is a different point with Vue Document (v-for, v-if)
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/gkuer](https://github.com/gkuer)







### Steps to reproduce
in https://v3.vuejs.org/guide/list.html#v-for-with-v-if,
'When they exist on the same node, v-if has a higher priority than v-for' 

in https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/list.html#v-for-with-v-if,
'When they exist on the same node, v-for has a higher priority than v-if'

they mean antonym each other.
the translation (ex. korean) also same state.

### What is expected?
they mean antonym each other.

### What is actually happening?
the translation (ex. korean) also same state.

---
in korean, 
'When they exist on the same node, v-if has a higher priority than v-for'
=== ' 동일한 노드에 두가지 모두 있다면, v-if가 v-for보다 높은 우선순위를 갖습니다. '


<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "There is a different point with Vue Document (v-for, v-if) " (#12378)

Issues.Title: Dynamic class binding's object syntax applied to <component> tag
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
It allows binding the component's name by using `:is="{...}"` keyword directly in the template using an object syntax. For components like Snackbar/Toast, this would be quicker and cleaner than having to do so in the `data()` or `setup()`. If we can switch CSS classes using object syntax, why cannot it be done in the exact same way for the components?

### What does the proposed API look like?
```
<component
  :is="{
      'SuccessIcon': type == SnackbarType.Success,
      'WarningIcon': type == SnackbarType.Warning,
      'InfoIcon': type == SnackbarType.Info,
      'ErrorIcon': type == SnackbarType.Error
  }"
  :class="{
      'success-color': type == SnackbarType.Success,
      'warning-color': type == SnackbarType.Warning,
      'info-color': type == SnackbarType.Info,
      'error-color': type == SnackbarType.Error
  }"
/>
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dynamic class binding's object syntax applied to <component> tag" (#12377)

Issues.Title: fix #12374: do not hyphenate or omit CSS variables in style attribute
Issues.Body:
close #12374

This PR adds a specific test for CSS variables and solves the issue. So it behaves the same as the vue browser renderer.

Issues.Title: vue-server-renderer: CSS variables get lost in dynamic style attributes
Issues.Body:
### Version 2.6.14 ### Reproduction link [github.com](https://github.com/fieteboerner/broken-vue-server-renderer-demo) ### Steps to reproduce 1. git clone https://github.com/fieteboerner/broken-vue-server-renderer-demo 2. cd broken-vue-server-renderer-demo 3. npm install 4. node index.js ### What is expected? The SSR `node index.js` command should print the exact same output as the [vue renderer in the browser](https://sfc.vuejs.org/#) ```
Hello World
``` ### What is actually happening? ```
Hello World
``` The Variable with the integer value is missing, and the lowerCamelCase Variables are converted to kebap-cased variables. This breaks the UX of our application because the content is jumping since the missing/malformed Variables are not matching the ones in the actual CSS. After rehydration in the Browser, the correct style-Attributes get rendered, and our Styles take effect. --- ### Sidenote in version 2.5.0 the variable with the numeric value does not get lost. This is the output from version 2.5.0: ```
Hello World
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "vue-server-renderer: CSS variables get lost in dynamic style attributes" (#12374)

Issues.Title: Vue 2 v-bind Tag Action in Dev version and in Product Action is diffrerent
Issues.Body:
### Version 2.6.14 ### Reproduction link [github.com/vuejs/vue/tree/2.6](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/tree/2.6) ### Steps to reproduce Vue 2 v-bind Tag Action in Dev version and in Product Action is Differenct. I Use This test code to Test ```HTML Document
``` if i use /2.6.9/vue.js the devetools isn't print 2323,but if i use /2.6.9/vue.min.js it print 2323 but in 3.x version,the action is same,not print 2323 ### What is expected? Make them behave the same ### What is actually happening? In 2.6.9 Dev version Microsoft Edge 96 Developtools not print log 2323 Product version Microsft Edge 96 Developtools print log 2323 In 3.x Them same not print log 2323
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Vue 2 v-bind Tag Action in Dev version and in Product Action is diffrerent" (#12373)

Not an API request

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:
- [ ] A convincing reason for adding this feature (to avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a suggestion issue first and wait for approval before working on it)

**Other information:**

### What problem does this feature solve? Allows you to create a scoped block of HTML without having to create a component (similar to petite-vue). This has already been mentioned [here](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/issues/12212). However after searching for the issue/PR for hours I still cannot find it. Please could you either keep this issue, re-open the original issue or add a comment which atleast links to the issue/pr. ### What does the proposed API look like? ```
{{ count }}
```

Issues.Title: Routes with same path don't register
Issues.Body:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vue-router

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->

```js
const routes = [
  {
    path: `/logout`,
    name: `login page`,
    component: Home, // () => import(`../views/Login.vue`),
  },
  {
    path: `/login`,
    name: `login page`,
    component: () => import(`../views/Login.vue`),
  },
]
```

`/logout` doesn't work (fall backs to 404) but when removing the second path in the route (/login) `/logout ` works

I can provide a reproducible example if necessary 

Please make vue router warn about routes with same names
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Routes with same path don't register" (#3675)

Issues.Title: Safari scrollBehavior key is undefined but exists
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.3

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/safari-scrollbehavior-gh2fx)







### Steps to reproduce
Click on the router-link in safari.

### What is expected?
Smooth scrolling

### What is actually happening?
Scroll quickly to an element

---
https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/cb4c16398bf25aaa2c5d755faa480ad1e81cd756/src/util/scroll.js#L164

This line returns `false`. I'm using a safari [polyfill](https://github.com/iamdustan/smoothscroll) that enables smooth scrolling with `window.scrollTo`, but smooth scrolling doesn't work because `vue-router` uses a different interface with two arguments.

`window.scrollTo(x, y)` instead of `window.scrollTo({ top, left })`

An even more interesting situation arises when you execute code in the browser console: `Object.keys(document.documentElement.style).includes('scrollBehavior')`

This code will return `true`, because the `scrollBehavior` key is present in the object.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Safari scrollBehavior key is undefined but exists" (#3674)

The banner is closable and opens Vue School's Cyber Monday promo page in a new tab. The banner will not reappear if a user has closed it (stored in local storage).

Issues.Title: Safari scrollBehavior key is undefined but exists
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/cb4c16398bf25aaa2c5d755faa480ad1e81cd756/src/util/scroll.js#L164

This line returns false. I'm using a safari [polyfill](https://github.com/iamdustan/smoothscroll) that enables smooth scrolling with `window.scrollTo`, but smooth scrolling doesn't work because vue-router uses a different interface with two arguments.

`window.scrollTo(x, y)` instead of `window.scrollTo({ top, left })`

An even more interesting situation arises when you execute code in the browser console: `Object.keys(document.documentElement.style).includes('scrollBehavior')`

This code will return true, because the scrollBehavior key is present in the object.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Safari scrollBehavior key is undefined but exists" (#3673)

Issues.Title: router.currentRoute.value is reset to homepage when saving with Vite HMR activated
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.12

### Reproduction link
[stackblitz.com](https://stackblitz.com/edit/vite-82dmj6?devtoolsheight=33&file=src/App.vue)







### Steps to reproduce
Create vue router add a route to it
Add it to Vue 
Navigate to said page, the value of the currentRoute is correctly set
Make any change to the componenet where currentRoute.value is called, save
The page will reload with Vite HMR
Value of the currentRoute is set to the homepage

### What is expected?
The currentRoute should still be equal to the route we are currently on

### What is actually happening?
The currentRoute value isn't properly set

---
Thought it had to do with params at first since it was the only time i was using currentRoute.value.params.xxx but it seems to affect every page.

I made a gif showing to situation for clarification : 

![Animation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26070848/143688237-5d116194-dd32-43ec-a98e-9cb992ad516c.gif)

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "router.currentRoute.value is reset to homepage when saving with Vite HMR activated" (#3671)

Steps to reproduce

What is expected?
The currentRoute should still be equal to the route we are currently on

What is actually happening?
The currentRoute value isn't properly set

Thought it had to do with params at first since it was the only time i was using currentRoute.value.params.xxx but it seems to affect every page.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "router.currentRoute.value is reset to homepage when saving with Vite HMR activated" (#3670)

Issues.Title: Delayed start for fetching routes data
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Some apps does not know routes structure in a compile time, but have to fetch some data in a run time. My use-case is content app which have to download content from CMS and then generate routes.

But currently in a meantime it reports "[Vue Router warn]: No match found for location with path". After routes loaded I have to call this.$router.replace(this.$route.fullPath).

### What does the proposed API look like?
Option like start: false in createRouter.
Method like router.start().

Or just document how to solve it by current API. There are [some workarounds](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/issues/1377#issuecomment-368498552), but they feels like a hacking.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Delayed start for fetching routes data" (#3668)

Issues.Title: Docs: Update Vue School Black Friday banner
Issues.Body:
This PR updates the Black Friday Vue School banner, adding a subtle animation to the background coins.

When the cursor is over the banner, the coins move from left to right or right to left, according to the mouse X position when is over the banner. This uses CSS transforms.

This is implemented only for desktop (1024px and wider resolutions). Tablet and mobile viewports have no animation and stay unmodified.

You can check the [video preview here](https://imgur.com/a/sfhkUkv).

Related to PR [3664](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/pull/3664)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Docs: Update Vue School Black Friday banner" (#3665)

Issues.Title: next in beforeEach is useless when we call addRoute in beforeEach
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.3

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/eloquent-elgamal-zdwdq?file=/src/router/index.js)







### Steps to reproduce
At the first, you are in `/route1`, you can click 'home', '/route2', '/route1', that's all ok. 
But the first time you click '/route3', you can not see it. You must click '/route3' the second time, it will show.

### What is expected?
The first time we click `/route3`, it will show.

### What is actually happening?
route3 didn't show at the first time it been clicked.

---
Why do we transitionTo START after we addRoute? https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/src/index.js#L257-L259

It seems there is a bug. When we call addRoute in beforeEach, next will be useless.

When we navigation to a route, router.history.pending = route (https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/src/history/base.js#L139) . Then we call addRoute, and addRoute calls trnasitionTo, it will change the pending to currentLocation, so we call next will be ignored (https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/src/history/base.js#L192-L194).

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "next in beforeEach is useless when we call addRoute in beforeEach" (#3660)

Issues.Title: If a new version of the application is deployed , the VueX is not reactive until user does a hard refresh
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.1.2

### Reproduction link
[sfc.vuejs.org/](https://sfc.vuejs.org/#)







### Steps to reproduce
Hi Team,

I am using the Vue 2 and the following VueX libraries,
"vuex": "^3.1.2",
"vuex-oidc": "^3.5.1",
"vuex-persistedstate": "^2.7.1"

My Issue:

this cannot be reproduced by code pen or sand box .

I am using a microfront-end, some of the modules developed by angular js and some of the modules are developed by vue js
user is working on application version-1, meanwhile the version-2 is deployed.
if user navigates to a page which is developed by Angular and if he comes back to the pages which is using vue js, I can see all the new changes but when I change the values in vuex.
The setter is working (vueX persisted store updating the localstorage) but getter is not (reactive) returning the new value.

### What is expected?
the state should be reactive

### What is actually happening?
The setter is working (vueX persisted store updating the localstorage) but getter is not (reactive) returning the new value.

---
if I do a refresh, it is working fine. but I wants to solve without a refresh.

is there anyway to solve the reactive issue of the VueX in this scenario?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "If a new version of the application is deployed , the VueX is not reactive until user does a hard refresh" (#2095)

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.

My Issue:

I am using a microfront-end, some of the modules developed by angular js and some of the modules are developed by vue js
user is working on application version-1, meanwhile the version-2 is deployed. 
if user navigates to a page which is developed by Angular and if he comes back to the pages using vue js, I can see all the new changes but when I change the values in vuex. 
The setter is working (vueX updating the localstorage) but getter is not (reactive) returning the new value.

if I do a refresh, it is working fine. but I wants to solve without a refresh.

is there anyway to solve the reactive issue of the VueX in this scenario?

Issues.Title: npm run build reports an error, use the latest version of @vue/devtools-api
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.2

### Reproduction link
[github.com](https://github.com/cmdfas/vuex/tree/4.0)







### Steps to reproduce
When using the @vue/devtools-api@^6.0.0-beta.11 version in the yarn.lock file, there is no problem.

But when I upgraded to the latest @vue/devtools-api@6.0.0-beta.20.1 version, npm run build reported an error.

Here is the error:

```
src/index.cjs.js → dist/vuex.global.js...
[!] (plugin buble) CompileError: Transforming async functions is not implemented. Use `transforms: { asyncAwait: false }` to skip transformation and disable this error. (92:23)
node_modules/@vue/devtools-api/lib/esm/proxy.js (92:23)
88 :                 }
89 :             },
90 :         });
91 :     }
92 :     async setRealTarget(target) {
                            ^^^^^^^^^^
```


### What is expected?
npm run build has no errors

### What is actually happening?
npm run build reports an error

Issues.Title: Access globalProperties in store
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
We should be able to access the globalProperties or the Vue instance in the store.

For exemple, I add a custom axios to my globalProperties `app.config.globalProperties.$axios = axios`. In a mutation, I want to get some values by calling my custom axios defined in globalProperties and add them in a state. 

### What does the proposed API look like?
In vuex 3, used to have _vm in the store, so why not do something similar ?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Access globalProperties in store" (#2088)

Issues.Title: mapState(["key1", {key2 :'key3'})
Issues.Body:
`.map(key => ({ key, val: key }))`
`.reduce((acc, cur)=> {acc.push({ key: cur, val: cur}); return acc}, [])`
I'm not aware of the performance issues Is there a relatively big impact(reduce / map)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "mapState(["key1", {key2 :'key3'})" (#2085)

Issues.Title: Define state when preserved is true, but there is nothing to preserve
Issues.Body:
Vuex handles modules defined in the constructor options different from those registered with store.registerModule. For registerModule calls, the modules pass for a variety of checks before being embedded in the global store.

When checking in "installModule" if the module should be at the root and if the "state" should not be preserved is not observed that if "hot" is set to true, but the state was not defined before throws an error inside the mutation called to change state like "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'foo')".

That occurs because it was preserved a no existing state. That's why we should check if the state already exists if so, it will be preserved otherwise we set the default from the module. 

The fast way to verify this bug is creating a project from scratch, adding vuex, creating a module (I did it in a separate file), setting the namespace to true, registering it like "store.registerModule('bar', module, {preserveState:true})". Now at a vue file call from a a method "this.$store.dispatch('bar/setValue', {name:'foo'})".

Fixes #2083
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Define state when preserved is true, but there is nothing to preserve" (#2084)

Issues.Title: Define state when preserved is true, but there is no state to preserve
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.4.0

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/embed/optimistic-pine-hqsbc?fontsize=14&hidenavigation=1&theme=dark)







### Steps to reproduce
The fast way to verify this bug is creating a project from scratch, adding vuex, creating a module (I did it in a separate file), setting the namespace to true, registering it like "store.registerModule('bar', module, {preserveState:true})". Now at a vue file call from a a method "this.$store.dispatch('bar/setValue', {name:'foo'})".

### What is expected?
The value is to be set correctly.

### What is actually happening?
Throws a error. 

[Vue warn]: Error in v-on handler: "TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'user')"

---
Vuex handles modules defined in the constructor options different from those registered with store.registerModule. For registerModule calls, the modules pass for a variety of checks before being embedded in the global store.

When checking in "installModule" if the module should be at the root and if the "state" should not be preserved is not observed that if "hot" is set to true, but the state was not defined before throws an error inside the mutation called to change state like "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'foo')".

That occurs because it was preserved a no existing state. That's why we should check if the state already exists if so, it will be preserved otherwise we set the default from the module. 

I need the value to be preserved due to the vuex-persistedstate that I'm using and I don't want to get overridden, but at the same time if no state is to be preserved the module default state should be defined.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Define state when preserved is true, but there is no state to preserve" (#2083)

Issues.Title: feat: add named export in cjs format file
Issues.Body:
`export default` has many bugs when mixed with `commonjs`, `vuex` use export default object in `vuex.cjs.js` which  behavior is not like `vue-router-next`. It cause the below code cannot get correct value in the lastest vite version

```js
import { createStore } from 'vuex'
console.log(createStore === undefined)
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat: add named export in cjs format file" (#2081)

console.log(createStore === undefined)
```

Issues.Title: Unable to use module mutations or actions
Issues.Body:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vuex

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->

I'm recently facing some troubles while using Vuex. 
I have two modules: user and categories.

I use the following code to register the two modules in the store/index.js file. 

    import Vue from 'vue'
    import Vuex from 'vuex'
    
    import categories from "./categories"
    import user from './user'
    console.log(categories)
    
    Vue.use(Vuex)
    
    export default new Vuex.Store({
      modules: {
        user: user,
        categories: categories,
      }
    })



After execution, I am able to find states in both modules in the path ```$store.state.moduleName.moduleStates```. However, I am unable to find mutations nor actions.

I first tried to set namespace to false, the mutations and actions were not registered as global mutations and actions. (There are no such mutations or actions at all)

I then tried to set namespace to true, the mutations and actions were not registered as namespaced mutations and actions neither. (```this.$store.commit('moduleName/mutationName')``` doesn't work; an error message pops up: ```[vuex] unknown action type: categories/getAllCategories```)

I tried to debug by printing out the 'categories' module object and the store object and I found that:

 1. Modules themselves are correctly defined. Mutations and Actions are correctly defined in the module object.
 2. Module states are correctly registered in store.state (as per previously tested)
 3. Module mutations and actions are not correctly registered in ```store._mutations``` and ```store._actions``` (no matter the modules are namespaced or not, the mutations and actions don't appear as global or namespaced properties); ```store._mutations``` and ```store._actions``` show as empty objects. 
 4. Modules can be seen in ```store._modules.root._children``` and ```store._modules.root._rawModule```

The result of console.log(categories) and console.log(this.$store) are shown: 
[![console.log(categories)][1]][1]

------

[![console.log(this.$store)][2]][2]


Can someone help me to solve the issue?


  [1]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/8cdba.png
  [2]: https://i.stack.imgur.com/qeSjU.png
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to use module mutations or actions" (#2077)

Issues.Title: Can't resolve 'node_modules/vuex/types/index'
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.2

### Reproduction link
[sfc.vuejs.org/](https://sfc.vuejs.org/#)







### Steps to reproduce
- In a nodejs app open app.js with VSCode and type "import create"
- Select "createStore / node_modules/vuex/types/index" and press enter
- Results in "import { createStore } from 'node_modules/vuex/types/index';"
- Execute "npm run watch"
- Fails with "Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'node_modules/vuex/types/index' in '/var/www/vhosts/yourwebsite/httpdocs/resources/js'"
- Change "import { createStore } from 'node_modules/vuex/types/index';" to "import { createStore } from 'vuex';"
- "npm run watch" now works BUT autocompletion for the "store" is no longer available

### What is expected?
"npm run watch" should work simultaneous with autocompletion

### What is actually happening?
"npm run watch" works or autocompletion works, not both

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't resolve 'node_modules/vuex/types/index'" (#2076)

Issues.Title: DeprecationWarning: Use of deprecated folder mapping "./" in the "exports" field module resolution of the package at PATH_TO_PROJECT/node_modules/vuex/package.json.
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.2

### Reproduction link
[github.com](https://github.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1456/commits/93359b729275672a56c11aa41c20129e9158b36a)
I used a PR that solved the [same exact issue](https://github.com/postcss/postcss/issues/1455) in postcss.







### Steps to reproduce
Environments:
node v16.11.1
npm v8.0.0
@vue/cli 4.5.13

Vue 3 project (v3.2.20)

Steps:
1) Run "vue ui"

### What is expected?
No warnings

### What is actually happening?
This warning:

(node:19450) [DEP0148] DeprecationWarning: Use of deprecated folder mapping "./" in the "exports" field module resolution of the package at PATH_TO_PROJECT/node_modules/vuex/package.json.
Update this package.json to use a subpath pattern like "./*".
(Use `node --trace-deprecation ...` to show where the warning was created)

---
This is likely caused by new deprecation warnings introduced in node 16.

It was already fixed in postcss by updating the deprecated folder mapping to use a subpath pattern.
See this PR:
https://github.com/postcss/postcss/pull/1456/commits/93359b729275672a56c11aa41c20129e9158b36a

All they did was replace this line
"./": "./"

with this
"./*": "./*"

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "DeprecationWarning: Use of deprecated folder mapping "./" in the "exports" field module resolution of the package at PATH_TO_PROJECT/node_modules/vuex/package.json." (#2071)
